intro: Paraboea leucocodon, commonly known as the white-flowered paraboea, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its stems are often hairy and can twine around supporting structures. Paraboea leucocodon is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments.
